Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the timeframe in which the deaths occurred, stating that the servicemen died "this week" when in fact they died in 2010.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the deaths of the servicemen were reported by news media at the time.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that not all of the servicemen were U.S. Marines.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the assertion that there was no media coverage or mention of the servicemen's names.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the lack of media coverage or mention of the servicemen's names is indicative of a deliberate disregard or negligence, without considering other factors that may have influenced media coverage.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the lack of media coverage or mention of the servicemen's names may be due to factors such as the passage of time or the specific circumstances surrounding their deaths.
